answers.answer: I may have it too.. did the 3 hr test and still waiting on the result. Besides measuring weeks ahead.. how has it been going for ya? What do they have you doing.. ex finger pricks exercise?
So far I don't know much, they are prescribing me the finger prick thing and I'll have to keep my sugar levels in a book for the rest of my pregnancy but they didn't say much about it
Ive got my GD test coming up and I'm very nervous!! :/
I have GD .... known sense 24 wks. Im 34 now. I check my levels 4X a day. All my levels are good... she keeps an eye on them. Water.... LOTS of water helps so much with GD.
Need to work on my water intake :/ best wishes ladies.
Same here. 4x a day everyday. No fun at all.

I have Type 1 Diabetes... I am 15w4d pregnant with my first baby. I take Glucophage 1,000mg in the mornings and I have to inyect myself with insulin 3 times a day... I have to take the blood sample from my finger 4 times a day... THIS is not fun at all... I have this for life, your will pass once you guve birth (well, some of you may keep being diabetics) ... And I am over over weight, all of this makes me feel terrible and scared! I just want my baby to be healthy. Thank God at my las ob/gyn visit he congratulated me because my blood sugar levels were awesome and I lost 2 pounds. Believe me, isHARD! But not impossible! :) so cheer up! If I can u can!

question: I'm 30w and I failed my glucose, I'm measuring 2w ahead. And on top of all this I'm having the most painful Braxton hicks. To the point I feel sick and I can't breath and they last about 5-7 min :( ugh this isn't fun
title: I have gestational diabetes
